availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James F. Landrum (Caldwell County, Kentucky, veteran on war of 1812 and farmer)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, soldier and farmer. Virginia native. Married to Patience Landrum. Father of Jemima Landrum, Joseph Landrum, and Sarah Landrum. Served in Greenhill's Virginia Militia as a sergeant in the War of 1812. Farmer in Farmersville, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Farmersville, p. 129.
Complied Service Records of Volunteer Soldiers who Served During the War of 1812, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M602, Roll 0121.
